directions: Blend basil leaves, mayonnaise, and shallot in processor until smooth. Gradually blend in buttermilk and lemon juice. Season dressing to taste with salt and pepper. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and refrigerate.)
Mix Asiago cheese, currants, and pumpkin seeds in medium bowl.
Using 1/6 of couscous, 1/6 of arugula, 1/6 of tomatoes, 1/6 of chicken, 1/6 of corn, and 1/6 of Asiago cheese mixture, form rows on each of 6 plates. Serve, passing dressing separately.
Available at specialty foods stores and some supermarkets.
ingredients: 1 10-ounce package plain couscous, cooked according to package instructions (about 5 cups)
1 pound plum tomatoes, seeded, diced (about 2 cups)
2 cups fresh corn kernels (from about 2 ears)
title: Chopped Salad with Chicken, Couscous, and Vegetables
